intro: Psychotria fusiformis, commonly known as the fusiform psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually greenish-white with prominent yellow stamens, and it produces small, dark blue to black berries. Psychotria fusiformis is often found in lowland rainforests and is part of the diverse flora in these ecosystems.
